questions.question: The struggle for equality aimed to remove ____.
questions.answer: Social inequalities

questions.question: Who worked for the upliftment of the depressed classes?
questions.answer: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar

questions.question: Which movement fought against untouchability?
questions.answer: Temple entry movement

questions.question: Who led the Mahad Satyagraha?
questions.answer: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar

questions.question: Which right ensures equality before law?
questions.answer: Right to Equality

questions.question: Which organization was founded by Dr. B.R. Ambedkar?
questions.answer: Bahishkrit Hitakarini Sabha

questions.question: Which movement demanded access to public water sources?
questions.answer: Mahad Satyagraha

questions.question: Who worked for women's rights along with social equality?
questions.answer: All of these

questions.question: Equality is essential for which type of society?
questions.answer: Democratic

questions.question: The struggle for equality helped in building a ____ India.
questions.answer: Strong and united

questions.question: What is meant by struggle for equality?
questions.answer: It refers to efforts made to remove social discrimination and ensure equal rights for all.

questions.question: Who was Dr. B.R. Ambedkar?
questions.answer: He was a social reformer who worked for the rights of the depressed classes.

questions.question: What was Mahad Satyagraha?
questions.answer: It was a movement led by Dr. Ambedkar to secure equal access to public water sources.

questions.question: Why is equality important in democracy?
questions.answer: Equality ensures justice, dignity and equal opportunities for all citizens.

questions.question: How did the struggle for equality help India?
questions.answer: It reduced social discrimination and strengthened democratic values.
